simphony.util.messages

Class AbstractMessageListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • simphony.util.messages.AbstractMessageListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageEventListener

    public abstract class AbstractMessageListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageEventListener
    An abstract MessageEventListener that will filter MessageEventListener events if they don't have the correct levels set.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.3 $ $Date: 2005/11/07 18:42:32 $
    Author:
    Jerry Vos

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractMessageListener()
      Creates this class with no specific Levels to accept, therefore it accepts all of them.
      AbstractMessageListener(java.lang.Iterable<org.apache.log4j.Level> listeningLevels)
      Creates this class with the specified Levels to accept.
      AbstractMessageListener(org.apache.log4j.Level... listeningLevels)
      Creates this class with the specified Levels to accept.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListeningLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level level)
      Adds a level that this class will accept and pass on to the #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object) method.
      java.util.Collection getListeningLevels()
      Retrieves the levels that this class accepts.
      void messageReceived(MessageEvent event)
      Recieves a MessageEvent and if either this class has no Levels associated with it, or if the event's Level is one of those held in this class, it will pass the event on to #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object).
      void removeListeningLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level level)
      Removes a level that this class will accept and pass on to the #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object) method.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMessageListener

        public AbstractMessageListener()
        Creates this class with no specific Levels to accept, therefore it accepts all of them.

      • AbstractMessageListener

        public AbstractMessageListener(org.apache.log4j.Level... listeningLevels)
        Creates this class with the specified Levels to accept. Any message with one of these levels will be accepted and passed on to the handleMessage(MessageEvent) method.
        Parameters:
        listeningLevels - levels to accept
        See Also:
        addListeningLevel(Level), removeListeningLevel(Level)

      • AbstractMessageListener

        public AbstractMessageListener(java.lang.Iterable<org.apache.log4j.Level> listeningLevels)
        Creates this class with the specified Levels to accept. Any message with one of these levels will be accepted and passed on to the handleMessage(MessageEvent) method.
        Parameters:
        listeningLevels - levels to accept
        See Also:
        addListeningLevel(Level), removeListeningLevel(Level)

    • Method Detail

      • messageReceived

        public void messageReceived(MessageEvent event)
        Recieves a MessageEvent and if either this class has no Levels associated with it, or if the event's Level is one of those held in this class, it will pass the event on to #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object).
        Specified by:
        messageReceived in interface MessageEventListener
        Parameters:
        event - the message event whose levels will be checked and possibly passed on to #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object)

      • addListeningLevel

        public void addListeningLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level level)
        Adds a level that this class will accept and pass on to the #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object) method.
        Parameters:
        level - a level that when found in a message event will cause that message to be accepted and passed on
        See Also:
        #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object)

      • removeListeningLevel

        public void removeListeningLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level level)
        Removes a level that this class will accept and pass on to the #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object) method.
        Parameters:
        level - a level that when found in a message event will cause that message NOT to be accepted and passed on
        See Also:
        #handleMessage(MessageEvent, Object)

      • getListeningLevels

        public java.util.Collection getListeningLevels()
        Retrieves the levels that this class accepts. If there are no Levels returned (ie the size of the collection is 0), then all Levels are accepted.
        Returns:
        the levels that this class accepts
